admission_text:
# MEMBERSHIP

## MEMBERSHIP

Become a member of The Amelia Island Museum of History and be a part of one of the finest museums of its kind on the east coast. The museum is noted for its spoken history tours, docent led walks through the historic district, and many other imaginative ways to tell our unique story.

With a fantastic line-up of exhibitions and programs for the entire family, members have exclusive opportunities to use our research facilities, free entry to the Museum and unique learning opportunities.

**_Annual Membership extends from January 1st thru December 31st of each year._** We appreciate your thoughtful consideration to join or renew your membership and help bring alive and preserve our area’s rich history.

[JOIN OR RENEW](https://fareharbor.com/embeds/book/ameliamuseum/items/596379/?full-items=yes&flow=1304229)

“I support our Museum because the history we have is incredibly marvelous and unique. The Museum is how we keep that history alive for others to enjoy and explore. This is the torch upon which we burn our perpetual flame.”

– Rob Hicks, local educator and author

“The Amelia Island Museum is one of our island’s treasurers, lovingly preserving & sharing with visitors Amelia Island’s incredible history & heritage”

– Berta Arias, author

“The Amelia Island Museum of History, through its collections and educational programs, draws people from near and far to take in our area’s history. It is an economic engine driven by those who recognize that ou...
accessibility_text:
The staff at AIMH aims to provide an accessible environment for all guests. Below is information that we hope will help you plan your visit. For any questions that may arise, do not hesitate to contact us at (904)261-7378.

## Preparing for your visit

  * Open: Monday – Saturday: 10 am – 4 pm / Sunday: 1 pm – 4 pm
  * Docent-led tours Monday – Saturday at 11 am and 2 pm / Sunday at 2 pm.  
(included with ticket purchase)
  * The Museum is wheel-chair accessible. Most doorways measure 36 inches with the narrowest doorway measuring 27 inches.
  * A wheel-chair is available at no charge that will fit through all doorways.
  * All restrooms are ADA accessible and feature a changing table for infants and small children.
  * School groups may be seen in the Museum. During these visits the Museum may be louder than normal. School groups are seen most often in the morning and typically in the spring months.
  * Sensory tips: You may bring your own fidget spinners, noise-canceling headphones or other items to help you have a more pleasant experience.

## Arriving at the Museum

  * The Museum is located at 233 South 3rd Street, Fernandina Beach, Florida, 32034. The entrance is in our main parking area located on the north side of the building.
  * We have one parking spot designated for physically challenged guests. There is an ADA accessible ramp at the front entrance.
  * There is a large xylophone that guests like to use. This can sometimes be loud and children may be particularly...
collections_text:
#### WELCOME TO THE

# Amelia Island  
muSEUM OF hISTORY

[DONATE NOW](http://ameliamuseum.org/donate/ "DONATE NOW")[VOLUNTEER NOW](http://ameliamuseum.org/volunteer/ "VOLUNTEER NOW")[MEMBERSHIP](http://ameliamuseum.org/membership/ "MEMBERSHIP")

## VISIT US

Step back in time and discover 4000 years of life on the water’s edge here on Amelia Island. From the Timucua Native American tribe to Spanish and French explorers, from the lawless spirit of pirates to the dignified air of Victorian-era residents, Amelia Island has been home to diverse cultures that have left an exciting heritage.

Open: Monday – Saturday: 10 am – 4 pm / Sunday: 1 pm – 4 pm / Free Friday Hours: 4 pm to 6 pm

Docent-led tours Monday – Saturday at 11 am and 2 pm / Sunday at 2 pm.  
(included with ticket purchase)

[READ MORE](http://ameliamuseum.org/about/ "READ MORE")[PURCHASE TICKET](http://ameliamuseum.org/purchase-tickets/ "PURCHASE TICKET")

[Explore our Exhibits](http://ameliamuseum.org/permanent-exhibit/ "Read More")

## COME EXPLORE WITH US

###### Pub Crawl

Enjoy history with a “kick” on this guided tour of our town’s most notorious, historic pubs.

[+Read More](http://ameliamuseum.org/pub-crawl/ "Read More")

###### Ghost Tour

Tip-toe through dark streets and walk in the footsteps of a bygone era as you enjoy skillful storytelling on this guided tour.

[+Read More](http://ameliamuseum.org/ghost-tour/ "Read More")

###### Walking Tours
